---
title: Custom Templates
description: Create your own like button templates with custom markup and styling.
---

import { LinkCard } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

<LinkCard
  title="Live Demo"
  description="See custom templates in action: house saves, product wishlists, recipe bookmarks, and thumbs-up buttons."
  href="https://demo.simplelikes.com"
/>

You can create completely custom templates with your own markup and styling.

## Creating a Custom Template

### Step 1: Create Your Template File

Create a new Antlers template in your project's `resources/views/` directory.

**File location:** `resources/views/partials/my-like-button.antlers.html`

**Template path:** `partials.my-like-button` (dots replace slashes, no file extension)

Example:

```html
{{# My Custom Like Button #}}

<div class="my-like-widget"
     x-data="simpleLikes({
        entryId: '{{ entry_id }}',
        liked: {{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }},
        count: {{ likes_count }},
        canInteract: {{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }},
        isLocked: {{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}
     })">

    {{ if can_interact }}
        <button @click="toggleLike()"
                :disabled="loading"
                class="my-like-btn">

            {{# Custom emoji-based display #}}
            <span x-text="liked ? '‚ù§Ô∏è' : 'ü§ç'" class="my-like-icon"></span>
            <span x-text="count" class="my-like-count"></span>
            <span x-show="loading" class="my-like-loading">...</span>
        </button>

        {{# Custom error display #}}
        <p x-show="errorMessage"
           x-text="errorMessage"
           class="my-like-error"></p>

    {{ else }}
        {{# Display-only version #}}
        <div class="my-like-display">
            <span>‚ù§Ô∏è</span>
            <span>{{ likes_count }}</span>
            {{ if is_locked }}
                <span class="my-like-locked">(Locked)</span>
            {{ /if }}
        </div>
    {{ /if }}
</div>
```

### Step 2: Use Your Template

**Option A: Per-tag usage**

```blade
{{ simple_like template_from="partials.my-like-button" }}
```

**Option B: Set as site-wide default**

To avoid adding `template_from` to every tag, set a default in your config:

```php
// config/simple-likes.php
'default_template' => 'partials.my-like-button',
```

Then just use the simple tag everywhere:

```blade
{{ simple_like }}
```

See [Configuration Options](/reference/configuration/#default-template) for more details.

## Available Template Variables

Your template receives these variables from Statamic:

| Variable | Type | Description |
|----------|------|-------------|
| `entry_id` | string | The unique ID of the entry (UUID format) |
| `likes_count` | integer | Total likes (boost + real interactions) |
| `user_has_liked` | boolean | True if the current user/guest has liked this entry |
| `is_authenticated` | boolean | True if the current user is logged in |
| `can_interact` | boolean | True if the user is allowed to like (based on permissions) |
| `allow_guest_likes` | boolean | True if guests can like this entry |
| `is_locked` | boolean | True if likes are disabled for this entry |

## Alpine.js Component Variables

When using the `simpleLikes` Alpine.js component, these reactive variables are available:

| Variable | Type | Description |
|----------|------|-------------|
| `liked` | boolean | Current like state (reactive, updates on toggle) |
| `count` | number | Current like count (reactive, updates on toggle) |
| `loading` | boolean | True while a like request is in progress |
| `errorMessage` | string | Error message to display (auto-clears after 5 seconds) |
| `errorType` | string | Error type: `'error'` or `'warning'` |
| `canInteract` | boolean | Whether the user can interact with the button |
| `isLocked` | boolean | Whether likes are locked for this entry |

### Using Error Messages

The `errorMessage` variable is populated when something goes wrong (rate limiting, network errors, etc.) and automatically clears after 5 seconds:

```html
{{# Show error message when present #}}
<p x-show="errorMessage"
   x-text="errorMessage"
   :class="{
       'text-red-500': errorType === 'error',
       'text-yellow-500': errorType === 'warning'
   }"></p>
```

### Loading State

Use the `loading` variable to show feedback during requests:

```html
<button @click="toggleLike()"
        :disabled="loading"
        :class="{ 'opacity-50 cursor-wait': loading }">
    <span x-show="!loading" x-text="liked ? '‚ù§Ô∏è' : 'ü§ç'"></span>
    <span x-show="loading">‚è≥</span>
    <span x-text="count"></span>
</button>
```

## Example: Minimal Button

A simple button with just an icon and count:

```html
<button x-data="simpleLikes({
    entryId: '{{ entry_id }}',
    liked: {{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    count: {{ likes_count }},
    canInteract: {{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    isLocked: {{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}
})"
@click="toggleLike()"
:disabled="loading || !canInteract || isLocked"
class="like-btn">
    <span x-text="liked ? '‚ù§Ô∏è' : 'ü§ç'"></span>
    <span x-text="count"></span>
</button>
```

## Example: Card with Animation

A more elaborate design with animations:

```html
<div class="like-card"
     x-data="simpleLikes({
        entryId: '{{ entry_id }}',
        liked: {{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }},
        count: {{ likes_count }},
        canInteract: {{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }},
        isLocked: {{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}
     })">

    <button @click="toggleLike()"
            :disabled="loading"
            class="like-card__btn"
            :class="{ 'like-card__btn--liked': liked, 'like-card__btn--loading': loading }">

        <svg class="like-card__heart"
             :class="{ 'like-card__heart--filled': liked }"
             viewBox="0 0 24 24">
            <path d="M4.318 6.318a4.5 4.5 0 000 6.364L12 20.364l7.682-7.682a4.5 4.5 0 00-6.364-6.364L12 7.636l-1.318-1.318a4.5 4.5 0 00-6.364 0z" />
        </svg>

        <span class="like-card__count" x-text="count"></span>

        <span class="like-card__label" x-text="count === 1 ? 'like' : 'likes'"></span>
    </button>

    <transition
        x-show="errorMessage"
        x-transition:enter="transition ease-out duration-200"
        x-transition:enter-start="opacity-0 transform -translate-y-2"
        x-transition:enter-end="opacity-100 transform translate-y-0"
        x-transition:leave="transition ease-in duration-150"
        x-transition:leave-start="opacity-100"
        x-transition:leave-end="opacity-0">
        <p class="like-card__error" x-text="errorMessage"></p>
    </transition>
</div>

<style>
.like-card__btn {
    display: flex;
    align-items: centre;
    gap: 0.5rem;
    padding: 0.5rem 1rem;
    border: 2px solid #e5e7eb;
    border-radius: 9999px;
    background: white;
    cursor: pointer;
    transition: all 0.2s;
}

.like-card__btn:hover {
    border-color: #ef4444;
}

.like-card__btn--liked {
    background: #fef2f2;
    border-color: #ef4444;
}

.like-card__btn--loading {
    opacity: 0.7;
    cursor: wait;
}

.like-card__heart {
    width: 1.5rem;
    height: 1.5rem;
    stroke: #ef4444;
    fill: none;
    transition: all 0.2s;
}

.like-card__heart--filled {
    fill: #ef4444;
    transform: scale(1.1);
}

.like-card__count {
    font-weight: 600;
    color: #374151;
}

.like-card__label {
    color: #6b7280;
    font-size: 0.875rem;
}

.like-card__error {
    margin-top: 0.5rem;
    color: #dc2626;
    font-size: 0.875rem;
}
</style>
```

## Vanilla JS Custom Template

For sites without Alpine.js, use data attributes:

```html
<div class="my-like"
     data-simple-likes
     data-entry-id="{{ entry_id }}"
     data-liked="{{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }}"
     data-count="{{ likes_count }}"
     data-can-interact="{{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }}"
     data-is-locked="{{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}">

    <button class="simple-likes-btn my-custom-btn">
        <svg class="simple-likes-heart" fill="none" stroke="#ef4444" viewBox="0 0 24 24">
            <path d="M4.318 6.318a4.5 4.5 0 000 6.364L12 20.364l7.682-7.682a4.5 4.5 0 00-6.364-6.364L12 7.636l-1.318-1.318a4.5 4.5 0 00-6.364 0z" />
        </svg>
        <span class="simple-likes-count">{{ likes_count }}</span>
    </button>

    <div class="simple-likes-error" style="display: none;"></div>
</div>
```

Remember to include the required classes (`.simple-likes-btn`, `.simple-likes-count`, `.simple-likes-heart`, `.simple-likes-error`) for the vanilla JS to work.

## Real-World Examples

The [live demo](https://demo.simplelikes.com) showcases several custom templates for different use cases:

### House Shortlist Button

A save button for property listings using a house icon:

```html
<div x-data="simpleLikes({
    entryId: '{{ entry_id }}',
    liked: {{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    count: {{ likes_count }},
    canInteract: {{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    isLocked: {{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}
})"
class="inline-flex items-centre gap-1.5">
    {{ if can_interact }}
        <button @click="toggleLike()"
                :disabled="loading"
                class="flex items-centre gap-1.5 px-3 py-1.5 rounded-full transition-all duration-200"
                :class="liked
                    ? 'bg-green-100 text-green-700 hover:bg-green-200'
                    : 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-600 hover:bg-gray-200'">
            <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-4 h-4" viewBox="0 0 24 24"
                 :fill="liked ? 'currentColor' : 'none'"
                 stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5">
                <path d="M3 10a2 2 0 0 1 .709-1.528l7-6a2 2 0 0 1 2.582 0l7 6A2 2 0 0 1 21 10v9a2 2 0 0 1-2 2H5a2 2 0 0 1-2-2z"/>
            </svg>
            <span class="text-sm font-medium" x-text="liked ? 'Saved' : 'Save'"></span>
            <span class="text-sm" x-text="count"></span>
        </button>
    {{ /if }}
</div>
```

### Product Wishlist Button

A star-based wishlist button for e-commerce:

```html
<button x-data="simpleLikes({
    entryId: '{{ entry_id }}',
    liked: {{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    count: {{ likes_count }},
    canInteract: {{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    isLocked: {{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}
})"
@click="toggleLike()"
:disabled="loading"
class="flex items-centre gap-1.5 px-3 py-1.5 rounded-full transition-all"
:class="liked
    ? 'bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-700 hover:bg-yellow-200'
    : 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-600 hover:bg-gray-200'">
    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-4 h-4" viewBox="0 0 24 24"
         :fill="liked ? 'currentColor' : 'none'" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5">
        <path d="M11.525 2.295a.53.53 0 0 1 .95 0l2.31 4.679a2.123 2.123 0 0 0 1.595 1.16l5.166.756a.53.53 0 0 1 .294.904l-3.736 3.638a2.123 2.123 0 0 0-.611 1.878l.882 5.14a.53.53 0 0 1-.771.56l-4.618-2.428a2.122 2.122 0 0 0-1.973 0L6.396 21.01a.53.53 0 0 1-.77-.56l.881-5.139a2.122 2.122 0 0 0-.611-1.879L2.16 9.795a.53.53 0 0 1 .294-.906l5.165-.755a2.122 2.122 0 0 0 1.597-1.16z"/>
    </svg>
    <span class="text-sm font-medium" x-text="liked ? 'In Wishlist' : 'Wishlist'"></span>
    <span class="text-sm" x-text="count"></span>
</button>
```

### Recipe Bookmark Button

A bookmark button for saving recipes:

```html
<button x-data="simpleLikes({
    entryId: '{{ entry_id }}',
    liked: {{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    count: {{ likes_count }},
    canInteract: {{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    isLocked: {{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}
})"
@click="toggleLike()"
:disabled="loading"
class="flex items-centre gap-1.5 px-3 py-1.5 rounded-full transition-all"
:class="liked
    ? 'bg-amber-100 text-amber-800 hover:bg-amber-200'
    : 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-600 hover:bg-gray-200'">
    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-4 h-4" viewBox="0 0 24 24"
         :fill="liked ? 'currentColor' : 'none'" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5">
        <path d="m19 21-7-4-7 4V5a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h10a2 2 0 0 1 2 2v16z"/>
    </svg>
    <span class="text-sm font-medium" x-text="liked ? 'Bookmarked' : 'Bookmark'"></span>
    <span class="text-sm" x-text="count"></span>
</button>
```

### Thumbs Up Button

A thumbs-up style for feedback or ratings:

```html
<button x-data="simpleLikes({
    entryId: '{{ entry_id }}',
    liked: {{ user_has_liked ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    count: {{ likes_count }},
    canInteract: {{ can_interact ? 'true' : 'false' }},
    isLocked: {{ is_locked ? 'true' : 'false' }}
})"
@click="toggleLike()"
:disabled="loading"
class="flex items-centre gap-1.5 px-3 py-1.5 rounded-full transition-all"
:class="liked
    ? 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-700 hover:bg-blue-200'
    : 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-600 hover:bg-gray-200'">
    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-4 h-4" viewBox="0 0 24 24"
         :fill="liked ? 'currentColor' : 'none'" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5">
        <path d="M7 10v12"/>
        <path d="M15 5.88 14 10h5.83a2 2 0 0 1 1.92 2.56l-2.33 8A2 2 0 0 1 17.5 22H4a2 2 0 0 1-2-2v-8a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h2.76a2 2 0 0 0 1.79-1.11L12 2a3.13 3.13 0 0 1 3 3.88Z"/>
    </svg>
    <span class="text-sm font-medium" x-text="count"></span>
</button>
```

:::tip
All these templates are available in the [demo source code](https://demo.simplelikes.com). The key is changing the icon, colours, and label text - the underlying `simpleLikes` component remains the same.
:::
